subject: RE: [junit] A test to verify that an event is generated
msgSnippet: What you want to test is whether your listener recieves the appropriate message, rigth?  Why not take a MockObjects (www.mockobjects.com) approach? public void
messageBody:
What you want to test is whether your listener recieves the appropriate
message, rigth? Why not take a MockObjects (www.mockobjects.com)
approach?


public void testEventGenerated()
{
MyClassThatFiresAnEvent myClass = new MyClassThatFiresAnEvent();
MyEventListener mockListener = new MyEventListener()
{
MyEvent actualEvent = null;

public void validate() throws {
MyEvent expectedEvent = new MyEvent("This worked!");

assertEquals(expectedEvent, actualEvent);
}

public void somethingHappened(MyEvent event)
{
actualEvent = event;
}
}
myClass.addMyEventListener(mockListener);


myClass.callMethodThatFiresTheEvent();
mockListener.validate();
}


Regards,

Manuel Amago.
